citation.article-title: Rhizobacter daucus gen. nov., sp. nov., the causal agent of carrot bacterial gall.

p.s: Description of Rhizobacter daucus sp. nov.
Rhizobacter daucus (dau'cus. daucus, generic name of the host plant, carrot)
Straight to slightly curved, gram-negative, encapsulated rods with round ends, 0.9 to 1.3 by 2.1 to 2.5 μm.
Nonsporeforming.
Usually a small number of cells in a population are motile with polar flagella or lateral flagella or both.
Poly-β-hydroxybutyrate granules are formed.
Chemoorganotrophic.
Pseudooligotrophic.
Forms tough, white, plicated colonies on DPPG agar plates, but yellowish white colonies on DYPG agar plates.
Forms copious flocs consisting of globuler cell aggregates in liquid media.
Aerobe with respiratory metabolism of glucose.
Utilizes D-glucose as a sole source of carbon and energy.

Positive for production of oxidase, catalase, urease, lipase (Tween 80), lecithinase, and H2S from cysteine; NO2 reduction; the o-nitrophenyl-β-D-galactopyranoside test; hydrolysis of esculin; pit formation on pectate gels at pH 7.0; susceptibility to 10 μg of vibriostatic agent O/129 phosphate; and growth inhibition by KCN.
Weakly positive in gelatin liquefaction tests.
Negative for denitrification, the gluconate test, the methyl red test, casein hydrolysis, and production of arginine dihydrolase, nitrogenase, acetoin, indole, fluorescent pigment, and 3-ketolactose.
Maximum NaCl tolerance, 0.7%.
Does not require growth factor or NaCl.

Can utilize as sole carbon sources D-arabinose, ribose, xylose, glucose, lactose, cellobiose, melibiose, sucrose, raffinose, starch, dextrin, glycogen, inulin, adonitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, salicin, galacturonate, lactate, mucate, quinate, tartrate, and methanol.
Cannot utilize as carbon sources trehalose, melezitose, dulcitol, erythritol, acetate, citrate, malonate, and benzoate.
The G+C content of the DNA is 66.9 to 70.6 mol%.
Ubiquinone QS.
Occurs in soil.
Plant pathogen causing galls on carrot roots in nature.
The tobacco hypersensitivity reaction is negative.
The type strain is strain H6 (= ATCC 43778 = ICMP 9400).
